@Electrical_field_2D/sens_matrix.m

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 % =====================================================================
00002 %> @brief sens_matrix calculates sensitivity matrix using sensitivity maps for electrodes pairs
00003 %>
00004 %> @param V     potential map for one pair of electrodes
00005 %> @param draw  draw calculated map if ~= 0
00006 %> @retval S sensitivity map
00007 % =====================================================================
00008 function [S]=sens_matrix(ef_obj,V,draw)
00009 
00010 sm = 1;
00011 
00012 for el_a=1:ef_obj.number_of_electrodes
00013     if ef_obj.measurements_all==0
00014         num = ef_obj.number_of_electrodes;
00015     else
00016         num = el_a+ef_obj.number_of_electrodes-1;
00017     end
00018     for el_r=el_a+1:num
00019         if el_r > ef_obj.number_of_electrodes
00020             el_r = mod(el_r,ef_obj.number_of_electrodes);
00021         end
00022         if (el_a==1) d=draw;
00023         else d=0; 
00024         end
00025         S(:,:,sm) = ef_obj.sens_map(V(:,:,el_a), V(:,:,el_r));  
00026         
00027             if (el_r-el_a)==1 || (el_r-el_a+1)==ef_obj.number_of_electrodes
00028                 % limit max
00029                 %S(:,:,sm) = sens_map_limit(sensor,S(:,:,sm));
00030                 % smooth
00031                 %S(:,:,sm) = map_smooth(sensor,S(:,:,sm),sensor.calc_sensitivity.flag);
00032             end
00033             
00034         %ef_obj.draw_sensitivity_(S(:,:,sm), el_a, el_r, d); % draw only for first electrode
00035         sm = sm + 1;
00036     end
00037 end
